gaia::media::ExifInterface Class Reference

This is a class for reading and writing Exif tags in a JPEG file. More...

#include <ExifInterface.h>

  ORIENTATION_UNDEFINED = 0, ORIENTATION_NORMAL = 1, ORIENTATION_FLIP_HORIZONTAL = 2, ORIENTATION_ROTATE_180 = 3,

Detailed Description

This is a class for reading and writing Exif tags in a JPEG file.

double gaia::media::ExifInterface::getAltitude ( double  defaultValue)

Return the altitude in meters.

If the exif tag does not exist, return defaultValue.

Parameters:
defaultValuethe value to return if the tag is not available.
gaia::base::String gaia::media::ExifInterface::getAttribute ( const gaia::base::String &  tag)

Returns the value of the specified tag or. 

 null

if there is no such tag in the JPEG file.

Parameters:
tagthe name of the tag.
double gaia::media::ExifInterface::getAttributeDouble ( const gaia::base::String &  tag,
double  defaultValue 
)

Returns the double value of the specified rational tag.

If there is no such tag in the JPEG file or the value cannot be parsed as double, return defaultValue.

Parameters:
tagthe name of the tag.
defaultValuethe value to return if the tag is not available.
int32_t gaia::media::ExifInterface::getAttributeInt ( const gaia::base::String &  tag,
int32_t  defaultValue 
)

Returns the integer value of the specified tag.

If there is no such tag in the JPEG file or the value cannot be parsed as integer, return defaultValue.

Parameters:
tagthe name of the tag.
defaultValuethe value to return if the tag is not available.
bool gaia::media::ExifInterface::getLatLong ( const gaia::base::Array< float > &  output)

Stores the latitude and longitude value in a float array.

The first element is the latitude, and the second element is the longitude. Returns false if the Exif tags are not available.

gaia::base::ByteArray gaia::media::ExifInterface::getThumbnail ( )

Returns the thumbnail inside the JPEG file, or. 

 null

if there is no thumbnail. The returned data is in JPEG format and can be decoded using gaia.graphics.BitmapFactory::decodeByteArray(byte[],int,int)

bool gaia::media::ExifInterface::hasThumbnail ( )

Returns true if the JPEG file has a thumbnail.

void gaia::media::ExifInterface::saveAttributes ( )

Save the tag data into the JPEG file.

This is expensive because it involves copying all the JPG data from one file to another and deleting the old file and renaming the other. It's best to use setAttribute(String,String) to set all attributes to write and make a single call rather than multiple calls for each attribute.

void gaia::media::ExifInterface::setAttribute ( const gaia::base::String &  tag,
const gaia::base::String &  value 
)

static base::String gaia::media::ExifInterface::TAG_GPS_ALTITUDE ( ) [static]

The altitude (in meters) based on the reference in TAG_GPS_ALTITUDE_REF.

Type is rational.

static base::String gaia::media::ExifInterface::TAG_GPS_ALTITUDE_REF ( ) [static]

0 if the altitude is above sea level.

1 if the altitude is below sea level. Type is int.

Type is String.

static base::String gaia::media::ExifInterface::TAG_GPS_LATITUDE ( ) [static]

String.

Format is "num1/denom1,num2/denom2,num3/denom3".
